text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Criminal court starts trial of people accused of attempting to assasinate MP Abdullah al-Naibari. A group of gunmen shot and wounded Naibari and his wife on June 6.
- United Industries Co says net profit for the first half of 1997 amounted to 4.3 million dinars ($14 million).
- Germany says Iraq should comply with Security Council resolutions related to its 1990-91 occupation of Kuwait.
- Value of shares traded on the Kuwait Stock Exchange on Tuesday totalled 9.2 million dinars.
- Income of public sector functions makes about 75 percent of Gross Domestic Product.

- Kuwaiti parliamentarians to tour 40 countries in the coming three years to present Kuwait's POWs issue. Kuwait says Iraq is still holding some 600 Kuwaitis since its occupation of the Gulf state. Iraq denies this.
- Kuwait's May non-oil exports amount to 5.2 million dinars.
